getting-started.title: Getting Started
getting-started.description: Welcome to the world of Physical AI and Humanoid Robotics ðŸ¤–

intro.title: Introduction
intro.description: This book introduces you to the core concepts of modern robotics and AI systems.

module-1/chapter-1-core-concepts.title: Chapter 1: Core ROS 2 Concepts
module-1/chapter-1-core-concepts.description: This chapter covers the fundamental concepts of the Robot Operating System (ROS) 2.

module-1/chapter-2-rclpy-control.title: Chapter 2: Controlling Robots with rclpy
module-1/chapter-2-rclpy-control.description: rclpy is the official Python client library for ROS 2. It allows you to write ROS 2 nodes in Python and interact with the entire ROS 2 graph.

module-1/chapter-3-urdf-fundamentals.title: Chapter 3: URDF Fundamentals
module-1/chapter-3-urdf-fundamentals.description: The Unified Robot Description Format (URDF) is an XML format used in ROS to describe all elements of a robot model. This includes the robot's links, joints, sensors, and their physical properties.

module-1/chapter-4-joint-control-project.title: Chapter 4: Simple Humanoid Joint Control Project
module-1/chapter-4-joint-control-project.description: This project brings together all the concepts from the previous chapters to create a simple joint control project for our humanoid robot.

module-2/chapter-1-gazebo-physics.title: Chapter 1: Gazebo Physics
module-2/chapter-1-gazebo-physics.description: This chapter covers the fundamental concepts of physics simulation within Gazebo.

module-2/chapter-2-unity-digital-twin.title: Chapter 2: Building a Unity Digital Twin
module-2/chapter-2-unity-digital-twin.description: Unity is a powerful cross-platform game engine that can be used to create high-fidelity digital twins for robotics. A digital twin in Unity allows for realistic rendering, complex animations, and interactive human-robot experiences.

module-2/chapter-3-sensor-simulation.title: Chapter 3: Sensor Simulation
module-2/chapter-3-sensor-simulation.description: Simulating robot sensors is crucial for developing and testing perception and control algorithms without the need for expensive physical hardware. This chapter covers the principles behind simulating common sensors like LiDAR, Depth Cameras, and IMUs.

module-3-isaac/chapter-3-nav2-humanoid-p.title: Chapter 3: Nav2 Path Planning for Humanoids

module-3-isaac/chapter-4-isaac-sim-ros-w.title: Chapter 4: Isaac Sim â†’ Isaac ROS Workflow
module-3-isaac/chapter-4-isaac-sim-ros-w.description: 4.1 Introduction to Isaac Sim and Isaac ROS Integration

module-4-vla/chapter-1-voice-to-action.title: Chapter 1: Voice-to-Action
module-4-vla/chapter-1-voice-to-action.description: This chapter explores the fundamental concepts behind converting a spoken command into a robotic action. This voice-to-action pipeline is a cornerstone of modern human-robot interaction, enabling intuitive control of complex systems.

module-4-vla/chapter-2-cognitive-plannin.title: Chapter 2: Cognitive Planning
module-4-vla/chapter-2-cognitive-plannin.description: Cognitive planning is the "brain" of the autonomous robot. It involves taking a high-level, often abstract, goal and breaking it down into a concrete sequence of actions that the robot can execute. Large Language Models (LLMs) have emerged as a powerful tool for this task.

module-4-vla/chapter-3-capstone-overview.title: Chapter 3: Capstone Overview
module-4-vla/chapter-3-capstone-overview.description: This chapter provides a high-level overview of how the concepts from the previous chaptersâ€”voice-to-action and cognitive planningâ€”come together in a complete, autonomous humanoid robotics workflow. This is the "capstone" view that illustrates the full end-to-end system.
